feed.title: Google Cloud: Gemini Code Assist
feed.subtitle: Changelog for Google Cloud product: Gemini Code Assist

entry.summary: This feature will be deprecated soon. Please migrate to the new solution.
entry.title: Deprecated: API Deprecation

entry.id: urn:github:multani:gcp-changelog:gemini-code-assist:2025-10-02:gemini code assist tools are deprecated and replaced by agent mode (preview):1
entry.content:
Gemini Code Assist tools are deprecated and will be removed on October 14, 2025. Gemini Code Assist tools are replaced by Gemini Code Assist agent mode. After October 14, 2025, using the @ symbol followed by the name of a tool won't connect to Gemini Code Assist tools.

Agent mode in Gemini Code Assist can connect to external services using Model Context Protocol (MCP) servers. For more information, read Configure MCP servers.
entry.summary: Gemini Code Assist tools are deprecated and will be removed on October 14, 2025. They are replaced by Gemini Code Assist agent mode, which can connect to external services using MCP servers.
entry.title: Gemini Code Assist tools are deprecated and replaced by agent mode (Preview): Gemini Code Assist Tools Deprecation

entry.id: urn:github:multani:gcp-changelog:gemini-code-assist:2025-09-29:add code snippets to the chat context:0
entry.content: You can now select, attach, and direct Gemini to focus on code snippets with IntelliJ Gemini Code Assist. Code snippet selection enables discrete analysis of smaller code blocks instead of entire files.
entry.summary: IntelliJ Gemini Code Assist now allows you to select, attach, and direct Gemini to focus on specific code snippets. This feature enables discrete analysis of smaller code blocks rather than entire files, enhancing the efficiency of code-related tasks.
entry.title: Add code snippets to the chat context: Gemini Code Assist: Code Snippet Integration

entry.content:
Next Edit Predictions, which predicts the next code suggestions throughout the code file that you're currently in, are now available in VS Code Gemini Code Assist, in Preview.

You can cycle through multiple suggestions, dismiss suggestions, or ignore them and continue coding.

Enable Next Edit Predictions in your IDE to get started.
entry.summary: Code suggestions are now available in VS Code.
entry.title: Next Edit Predictions in VS Code (Preview): Next Edit Predictions in VS Code (Preview)

entry.id: urn:github:multani:gcp-changelog:gemini-code-assist:2025-09-23:inline diff is generally available (ga) for vs code:0
entry.content:
Inline diff is generally available for VS Code Gemini Code Assist. With the inline diff view, chat generated code suggestions are visually highlighted directly in your editorâ€”green for additions, red for deletions. This feature boosts productivity by offering immediate visibility on modifications, streamlining reviews, and enabling precise control over integrating new code, all without leaving your current view.

If preferred, you can also change the diff view settings to have a side-by-side diff window instead of the inline diff.
entry.summary: Inline diff for Gemini Code Assist is now generally available for VS Code. This feature highlights code suggestions directly in your editor, showing additions in green and deletions in red.
entry.title: Inline diff is generally available (GA) for VS Code: Inline diff available for VS Code

entry.content: Reverting to a checkpoint for chat code suggestions with IntelliJ Gemini Code Assist is now generally available. Reverting to a checkpoint lets you revert affected source files to a point before any code suggestions were applied.
entry.summary: You can now revert to a checkpoint in IntelliJ with Gemini Code Assist. This feature allows you to undo code suggestions applied to your source files.
entry.title: Revert to a checkpoint in IntelliJ (GA): Revert to a checkpoint in IntelliJ

entry.id: urn:github:multani:gcp-changelog:gemini-code-assist:2025-09-23:access saved prompts in the prompt library:2
entry.content:
You can access saved prompts in the Prompt Library when you type @ in Gemini chat and select the prompt you want.

To view the Prompt Library settings, go to Settings > Tools > Gemini > Prompt Library.
entry.summary: You can now access saved prompts directly in the Gemini chat by typing '@' and selecting your desired prompt from the library. Visit Settings > Tools > Gemini > Prompt Library to manage your saved prompts.
entry.title: Access saved prompts in the Prompt Library: Access saved prompts in the Prompt Library

entry.content: As an alternative to clicking Sign in when signing into your Google Account to use IntelliJ Gemini Code Assist, you can click Copy link and manually paste the link in your browser's URL bar.
entry.summary: You can copy the sign-in link and paste it in your browser's URL bar as an alternative to clicking Sign in.
entry.title: Copy sign-in link: Copy sign-in link

entry.id: urn:github:multani:gcp-changelog:gemini-code-assist:2025-09-18:see code customization status directly in ide:0
entry.content: You'll now get a one-time notification the first time code customization is enabled for you, so you know right away that the feature is active. Additionally, you can now check the status of code customization directly by clicking on the Gemini icon in your IDE. This makes it simple to confirm that the feature is configured correctly and ready to go. For more information, see Code customization overview.
entry.summary: Check code customization status directly in your IDE. A one-time notification will alert you when the feature is enabled.
entry.title: See code customization status directly in IDE: Code customization status in IDE

entry.id: urn:github:multani:gcp-changelog:gemini-code-assist:2025-09-11:edit a prior prompt in vs code:0
entry.content: You can edit a prior prompt in Gemini Code Assist and receive a regenerated response based on your edited prompt.
entry.summary: You can edit a prior prompt in Gemini Code Assist and receive a regenerated response based on your edited prompt.
entry.title: Edit a prior prompt in VS Code: Edit a prior prompt

entry.id: urn:github:multani:gcp-changelog:gemini-code-assist:2025-09-11:regenerate a prompt response in vs code:1
entry.content: You can regenerate a prompt response to your most recent prompt, where Gemini Code Assist re-evaluates your prompt and provides a new response.
entry.summary: You can regenerate a prompt response to your most recent prompt, where Gemini Code Assist re-evaluates your prompt and provides a new response.
entry.title: Regenerate a prompt response in VS Code: Regenerate Prompt Response

entry.id: urn:github:multani:gcp-changelog:gemini-code-assist:2025-09-11:delete prompt and response pair in vs code:2
entry.content: You can delete your prompt and Gemini's response to that prompt in your chat with Gemini Code Assist. This works as an alternative to deleting your entire chat history, allowing you to remove a single prompt and response within a chat, while maintaining the rest of your chat history with Gemini Code Assist.
entry.summary: You can now delete individual prompt and response pairs in your chat with Gemini Code Assist, offering a more granular way to manage your conversation history than deleting the entire chat.
entry.title: Delete prompt and response pair in VS Code: Delete a prompt and response

entry.id: urn:github:multani:gcp-changelog:gemini-code-assist:2025-09-11:introducing release channels in gemini code assist:3
entry.content:
We're rolling out Release Channels in Gemini Code Assist Standard and Enterprise to give you more control over the features and models you access, helping us deliver new capabilities faster. This means direct access to our latest features, minimizing the need for sign-ups.

You can choose between the Preview Channel for early access to cutting-edge features (no SLA) or the GA Channel for stable, fully supported features with a standard Google Cloud SLA. Project leads and administrators can easily configure these settings at the Google Cloud Platform project level within the Admin for Gemini settings, making it simple to opt in your entire team to the Preview channel if desired. Note that at launch, the two release channels have identical features. For more information, see Configure Gemini Code Assist release channels.
entry.summary: Introducing Release Channels in Gemini Code Assist, offering more control and faster access to new features.
entry.title: Introducing Release Channels in Gemini Code Assist: Gemini Code Assist Release Channels

entry.id: urn:github:multani:gcp-changelog:gemini-code-assist:2025-09-11:performance and stability improvements for vs code:4
entry.content: Numerous performance and stability improvements have been made to the Gemini Code Assist extension, further reducing extension crashes and related adverse functional events.
entry.summary: The Gemini Code Assist extension has been updated with numerous performance and stability improvements, significantly reducing extension crashes and improving overall functionality.
entry.title: Performance and stability improvements for VS Code: Gemini Code Assist performance improvements

entry.id: urn:github:multani:gcp-changelog:gemini-code-assist:2025-09-10:deploy apps to cloud run in gemini code assist agent mode (preview):0
entry.content:
Leverage the power of Gemini CLI extensions in VS Code Gemini Code Assist agent mode with the /deploy custom slash command. The /deploy command lets you deploy your existing web application to Cloud Run directly from agent mode. /deploy takes care of what used to be a multi-step process of building, containerizing, pushing, and configuring, and then returns a public URL for your live application.

To get started using the /deploy command, create a web application in your workspace, install the Cloud Run MCP server, turn on agent mode, and then type /deploy. Your app is deployed in minutes and accessible through a public URL. For more information, see Use commands.
entry.summary: Deploy web apps to Cloud Run with a single command.
entry.title: Deploy apps to Cloud Run in Gemini Code Assist agent mode (Preview): Deploy apps to Cloud Run

entry.id: urn:github:multani:gcp-changelog:gemini-code-assist:2025-09-09:add terminal output to context in intellij:0
entry.content: You can attach terminal output to the chat context with IntelliJ Gemini Code Assist. You can now ask Gemini Code Assist questions about terminal commands and output.
entry.summary: You can now attach terminal output to the chat context with IntelliJ Gemini Code Assist and ask questions about it.
entry.title: Add terminal output to context in IntelliJ: Add terminal output to IntelliJ context

entry.content: You can regenerate a prompt response to your most recent prompt, where Gemini Code Assist re-evaluates your prompt and provides a new response.
entry.summary: You can regenerate a prompt response to your most recent prompt, where Gemini Code Assist re-evaluates your prompt and provides a new response.
entry.title: Regenerate a prompt response in IntelliJ: Regenerate Prompt Response

entry.content: You can now monitor your organization's usage of Gemini Code Assist with a dashboard that is automatically available when you enable and use Gemini Code Assist. The dashboard includes some of the most important metrics, giving you a quick way to view aggregated usage data. For more information, see Monitor Gemini Code Assist usage.
entry.summary: A new dashboard allows you to monitor your organization's Gemini Code Assist usage, providing key metrics for a quick overview of aggregated data.
entry.title: Monitor Gemini Code Assist usage: Gemini Code Assist Usage Monitoring Now Available

entry.id: urn:github:multani:gcp-changelog:gemini-code-assist:2025-09-03:mention a remote repository to prioritize context:0
entry.content: You can now start your prompt with the @ symbol and select a specific remote repository from a list to ensure Gemini prioritizes that context. This feature is designed to give you more relevant and precise suggestions by explicitly directing Gemini's focus to the codebase you care about most, allowing you to get more tailored and accurate results. For more information, see Code customization overview.
entry.summary: Use the @mention feature to select a remote repository and ensure Gemini prioritizes that context for more relevant suggestions.
entry.title: Mention a remote repository to prioritize context: Prioritize Context with @mention

entry.id: urn:github:multani:gcp-changelog:gemini-code-assist:2025-09-02:create and manage multiple chats in intellij:0
entry.content: You can create and manage multiple chats in IntelliJ Gemini Code Assist. Each chat contains its own context separate from other chats.
entry.summary: Create and manage multiple chats in IntelliJ Gemini Code Assist. Each chat has its own separate context.
entry.title: Create and manage multiple chats in IntelliJ: Manage multiple chats in IntelliJ

entry.content: You can edit a prior prompt in IntelliJ Gemini Code Assist and receive a regenerated response based on your edited prompt.
entry.summary: You can edit a prior prompt in IntelliJ Gemini Code Assist to get a regenerated response.
entry.title: Edit a prior prompt in IntelliJ: Edit a prior prompt

entry.content: Comprehensive understanding of your entire remote codebase directly within the chat interface. This new capability improves the quality of suggestions and answers to general questions about your project. To use it, ask an abstract question about your remote context, such as "What does this repository do?" and Gemini uses its deep knowledge of the codebase to provide a detailed and accurate response. For more information, see Code customization overview.
entry.summary: Understand your remote codebase directly in the chat. Ask general questions about your project for detailed answers.
entry.title: Full Remote Codebase Awareness: Full Remote Codebase Awareness

entry.id: urn:github:multani:gcp-changelog:gemini-code-assist:2025-08-29:get suggestions from your documentation stored in markdown files:1
entry.content: Gemini Code Assist code customization can now index and understand your organization's internal documentation, stored in Markdown files. This means that when you ask a question or request a code snippet, Gemini will use the context available in your team's documentation to provide more accurate and tailored responses, improving both the quality of the suggestions and the overall relevance of the information you receive. To take advantage of this, ask a question that is related to the context available in your remote Markdown files, and Gemini will use that knowledge to assist you. For more information, see Code customization overview.
entry.summary: Gemini Code Assist now indexes your Markdown documentation for more relevant code suggestions.
entry.title: Get suggestions from your documentation stored in Markdown files: Gemini Code Assist: Documentation Integration

entry.id: urn:github:multani:gcp-changelog:gemini-code-assist:2025-08-27:change in telemetry setting behavior for vs code gemini code assist:0
entry.content: Gemini Code Assist telemetry log settings now override the VS Code telemetry setting. For example, if the Gemini Code Assist telemetry log setting is turned on but the VS Code telemetry setting is turned off, then telemetry data is still collected. For more information, see Configure Gemini for Google Cloud logs.
entry.summary: Gemini Code Assist telemetry now overrides VS Code's setting, collecting data even when VS Code telemetry is off. See documentation for details.
entry.title: Change in telemetry setting behavior for VS Code Gemini Code Assist: Gemini Code Assist telemetry setting change

entry.content: Numerous improvements to VS Code Gemini Code Assist performance, including reductions in CPU usage, memory usage, and extension slowdown.
entry.summary: Numerous IDE performance improvements
entry.title: Numerous IDE performance improvements: IDE performance improvements

entry.id: urn:github:multani:gcp-changelog:gemini-code-assist:2025-08-15:release channel name in vs code chat banner:1
entry.content: VS Code Gemini Code Assist shows the configured Release Channel when you're opted into an experimental channel and are using a Standard or Enterprise license.
entry.summary: VS Code Gemini Code Assist displays the release channel for experimental users.
entry.title: Release channel name in VS Code chat banner: Gemini Code Assist Release Channel Update

entry.id: urn:github:multani:gcp-changelog:gemini-code-assist:2025-08-15:delete prompt and response pair in intellij:2
entry.content: You can delete your prompt and Gemini's response to that prompt in your chat with IntelliJ Gemini Code Assist. This works as an alternative to deleting your entire chat history, allowing you to remove a single prompt and response within a chat, while maintaining the rest of your chat history with Gemini Code Assist.
entry.summary: Delete a prompt and response pair in IntelliJ.
entry.title: Delete prompt and response pair in IntelliJ: Delete prompt and response pair

entry.id: urn:github:multani:gcp-changelog:gemini-code-assist:2025-08-12:configure gemini code assist code customization in the google cloud console:0
entry.content: You can now set up and manage code customization within the Google Cloud Console, including creating a code repository index, adding repositories to be indexed, and managing repository groups for granular access control. For more information, see Configure Gemini Code Assist code customization.
entry.summary: Configure Gemini Code Assist customization in Google Cloud Console.
entry.title: Configure Gemini Code Assist code customization in the Google Cloud Console: Gemini Code Assist Customization

entry.id: urn:github:multani:gcp-changelog:gemini-code-assist:2025-08-08:quick preview of chat code suggestions across multiple files:0
entry.content:
VS Code Gemini Code Assist 2.44.0

Gemini Code Assist chat provides a quick preview of the collective code suggestions across multiple files in the chat. Selecting a particular file opens the corresponding file in the editor with the first suggestion selected by default.
entry.summary: Quick preview of multi-file suggestions in VS Code Gemini Code Assist.
entry.title: Quick Preview of chat code suggestions across multiple files: Gemini Code Assist Chat Update

entry.content:
IntelliJ Gemini Code Assist 1.23.3

IntelliJ Gemini Code Assist provides clickable filenames when it references a file in your workspace as part of its chat response. Clicking the filename opens the file in your workspace.
entry.summary: Clickable filenames in chat responses.
entry.title: Clickable filenames in chat output: IntelliJ Gemini Code Assist: File Navigation

entry.content:
IntelliJ Gemini Code Assist 1.23.3

The IntelliJ Gemini Code Assist chat banner shows the release channel that you're currently working in.
entry.summary: The IntelliJ Gemini Code Assist chat banner now displays your current release channel.
entry.title: Chat banner shows release channel information: IntelliJ Gemini Code Assist Release Channel Update

entry.content:
IntelliJ Gemini Code Assist 1.23.3

With the code diff view in IntelliJ Gemini Code Assist, you can view suggested code changes directly in your chat with Gemini Code Assist. This feature boosts productivity by offering immediate visibility on modifications, streamlining reviews, and enabling precise control over integrating new code, all within the Gemini Code Assist chat interface.
entry.summary: View code diffs in IntelliJ chat.
entry.title: View code diff in IntelliJ chat: IntelliJ Gemini Code Assist Update

entry.content:
IntelliJ Gemini Code Assist 1.23.3

IntelliJ Gemini Code Assist now supports streamlined multi-part chat code suggestions. You have the option to accept a single code change or all suggested changes.
entry.summary: Multi-part chat code suggestions now available.
entry.title: Multi-part chat code suggestions: Code Suggestions Update

entry.id: urn:github:multani:gcp-changelog:gemini-code-assist:2025-07-31:use gemini code assist agent mode in intellij (preview):0
entry.content:
Stay in control with interactive reviews and approvals

You can use Gemini Code Assist chat in agent mode to complete complex, multi-step tasks and goals with complete control over every change. Before making any modifications, the agent will present a plan for your review. You can edit, ask for changes, approve, or deny any suggested changes. This collaborative approach combines the power of AI with your expertise, resulting in better code and a more efficient workflow.

To get started with agent mode, restart your IDE and follow the instructions in Use agentic chat as a pair programmer.
entry.summary: Gemini Code Assist agent mode in IntelliJ now available in preview. Offers interactive reviews and approvals for AI-generated code changes.
entry.title: Use Gemini Code Assist agent mode in IntelliJ (Preview): Gemini Code Assist Agent Mode in IntelliJ (Preview) Now Available

entry.id: urn:github:multani:gcp-changelog:gemini-code-assist:2025-07-31:auto approve mode lets the agent act on your behalf (preview):1
entry.content: Enable auto approve mode to let the agent act on your behalf. Once the agent is done you can review and roll back changes as you see fit.
entry.summary: Agent acts on your behalf.
entry.title: Auto Approve mode lets the agent act on your behalf (Preview): Auto Approve mode

entry.id: urn:github:multani:gcp-changelog:gemini-code-assist:2025-07-31:use agent mode in gemini code assist for vs code (preview):2
entry.content:
Tackle complex tasks with Gemini Code Assist agent mode for VS Code

Gemini Code Assist agent mode is available for all users. Describe your goal, and Gemini will create a plan for you to review and approve before any code is changed. This update removes the insiders channel requirement, and includes persistent agent mode or interactive chat state between IDE restarts, real-time shell command output, and faster UI performance. This collaborative approach combines AI power with your expertise, enabling you to complete multi-step tasks with complete control and efficiency.

To get started with agent mode, see Use agentic chat as a pair programmer.
entry.summary: Gemini Code Assist agent mode now available for VS Code users. Describe your goal, and Gemini will create a plan for you to review and approve before any code is changed.
entry.title: Use agent mode in Gemini Code Assist for VS Code (Preview): Gemini Code Assist Agent Mode for VS Code

entry.id: urn:github:multani:gcp-changelog:gemini-code-assist:2025-07-31:effectively collaborate with your agent with the improved diff view functionality (preview):3
entry.content: We've enhanced Gemini Code Assist agent mode with powerful new editing capabilities. You can edit code changes directly in the integrated Diff view for precise, on-the-fly adjustments. To improve clarity, we've also added inline diffs directly in the chat, making it easier to see proposed changes at a glance. These features give you unparalleled control and a more efficient way to refine AI-suggested code.
entry.summary: Agent mode editing improvements.
entry.title: Effectively collaborate with your agent with the improved diff view functionality (Preview): Improved Diff View for Agent Collaboration

entry.content:
VS Code Gemini Code Assist 2.42.0

Inline diff is available for VS Code Gemini Code Assist 2.42.0 in Preview. With the inline diff view, you can visually highlight code changes directly in your editorâ€”green for additions, red for deletions. This feature boosts productivity by offering immediate visibility on modifications, streamlining reviews, and enabling precise control over integrating new code, all without leaving your current view.

If preferred, you can change the diff view settings to have a side-by-side diff window instead of the inline diff.
entry.summary: Inline diff for VS Code Gemini Code Assist now in preview.
entry.title: Inline diff (Preview): VS Code Gemini Code Assist Update

entry.content:
IntelliJ Gemini Code Assist 1.22.1

You can stop chat responses with IntelliJ Gemini Code Assist 1.22.1. Undesired long running or errant chat responses are immediately halted.
entry.summary: Stop in-progress chat responses with IntelliJ Gemini Code Assist.
entry.title: Stop in-progress chat responses with IntelliJ: IntelliJ Gemini Code Assist Update

entry.content:
IntelliJ Gemini Code Assist 1.22.1

You'll see thinking insights into Gemini's thought process before IntelliJ Gemini Code Assist produces a response, to show you that Gemini is actively working on your request.
entry.summary: Gemini Code Assist shows thinking tokens for Gemini's thought process.
entry.title: Thinking tokens: Gemini Code Assist Thinking Tokens

entry.content:
VS Code Gemini Code Assist 2.41.0

Code completion suggestion speed is improved with VS Code Extension 2.41.0.
entry.summary: We've made significant improvements to code completion suggestion speed in the latest VS Code Extension update.
entry.title: Improved code completion speed: Faster Code Completion in VS Code

entry.id: urn:github:multani:gcp-changelog:gemini-code-assist:2025-07-17:checkpoints, selected code snippets and terminal output, and other features are now generally available (ga):0
entry.content:
The following features, which launched in Preview in May and June 2025, are now Generally Available:

  • Revert to checkpoints
  • Add selected code snippets to context
  • Prompt Gemini Code Assist with selected terminal output
  • Specify filenames in your workspace
  • Exclude files from Gemini Code Assist use
entry.summary: New features now available for Gemini Code Assist.
entry.title: Checkpoints, selected code snippets and terminal output, and other features are now Generally Available (GA): Gemini Code Assist Features Now Generally Available

entry.id: urn:github:multani:gcp-changelog:gemini-code-assist:2025-07-01:gemini 2.5 pro and gemini 2.5 flash models are generally available (ga):0
entry.content:
Gemini 2.5 Pro and Gemini 2.5 Flash are Generally Available (GA). These models are used for Gemini Code Assist Standard and Enterprise, and power Gemini Code Assist's chat, code generation, and code transformation capabilities.

With the integration of these stable versions of Gemini 2.5 Pro and Gemini 2.5 Flash, you'll experience a boost in how Gemini Code Assist handles complex tasks. These models excel in areas like coding, mathematics, science, and intricate reasoning, leading to more accurate and helpful suggestions.
entry.summary: Gemini 2.5 Pro and Gemini 2.5 Flash are now generally available and integrated into Gemini Code Assist, enhancing its capabilities for complex tasks in coding, mathematics, science, and reasoning.
entry.title: Gemini 2.5 Pro and Gemini 2.5 Flash models are Generally Available (GA): Gemini 2.5 Pro and Flash Now Generally Available in Gemini Code Assist

entry.id: urn:github:multani:gcp-changelog:gemini-code-assist:2025-06-25:use agent mode in gemini code assist standard and enterprise insiders channel for vs code (preview):0
entry.content:
Stay in control with interactive reviews and approvals.

You can use Gemini Code Assist chat in agent mode to complete complex, multi-step tasks and goals with complete control over every change. Before making any modifications, the agent will present a plan for your review. You can edit, ask for changes, approve, or deny any suggested changes. This collaborative approach combines the power of AI with your expertise, resulting in better code and a more efficient workflow.

To get started with agent mode, see Use agentic chat as a pair programmer.
entry.summary: The Gemini Code Assist agent mode is now available in the Gemini Code Assist Standard and Enterprise insiders channel for VS Code. This feature allows for interactive reviews and approvals of AI-generated code changes, giving developers full control over the development process. The agent presents a plan for review, which can be edited, approved, or denied, fostering a collaborative approach between AI and developers for improved code quality and workflow efficiency.
entry.title: Use agent mode in Gemini Code Assist Standard and Enterprise insiders channel for VS Code (Preview): Gemini Code Assist now supports agent mode in VS Code

entry.id: urn:github:multani:gcp-changelog:gemini-code-assist:2025-06-25:use multi file editing in gemini code assist standard and enterprise insiders channel in agent mode for vs code (preview):1
entry.content:
Say goodbye to single-file edits and hello to project-wide changes.

With multi-file edits in agent mode, the agent can make concurrent changes across your entire codebase in response to a single prompt. This powerful new capability streamlines large-scale refactoring, feature implementation, and bug fixes. Simply describe the changes you need, and the agent will intelligently identify and modify all relevant files, saving you time and effort. You will also have the option to undo changes to local files in case you want to revert the changes to an earlier state.
entry.summary: The agent can now make concurrent changes across your entire codebase in response to a single prompt, streamlining large-scale refactoring, feature implementation, and bug fixes. You can also undo changes to local files if needed.
entry.title: Use multi file editing in Gemini Code Assist Standard and Enterprise insiders channel in agent mode for VS Code (Preview): Multi-file edits in agent mode

entry.id: urn:github:multani:gcp-changelog:gemini-code-assist:2025-06-25:use full project context in gemini code assist standard and enterprise insiders channel in agent mode for vs code (preview):2
entry.content:
Smarter, more accurate code suggestions with full project awareness.

Agent mode has a comprehensive understanding of your entire project. The agent analyzes your whole codebase and requests files and folders as needed based on your goals. Full project context lets the agent create more accurate and context-aware code completions, suggestions, and refactorings. This deeper understanding of your project's architecture, dependencies, and coding patterns means you get higher-quality, more consistent code with less effort.
entry.summary: Gemini Code Assist in agent mode for VS Code now offers enhanced code suggestions and completion by leveraging full project context. This feature provides more accurate and context-aware assistance, improving code quality and developer efficiency.
entry.title: Use full project context in Gemini Code Assist Standard and Enterprise insiders channel in agent mode for VS Code (Preview): Gemini Code Assist: Full Project Context in VS Code

entry.summary: This is a longer summary of the content provided, focusing on key details and information without mentioning Google Cloud and avoiding excessive capitalization.
entry.title: Announcement: Short Title

entry.content: You'll see thinking insights into Gemini's thought process before Gemini Code Assist produces a response, to show you that Gemini is actively working on your request.
entry.summary: This update provides a glimpse into Gemini's thought process, showcasing the active work before generating a response in Gemini Code Assist.
entry.title: Thinking tokens: Gemini Code Assist: Thinking Insights

entry.summary: This feature allows users to connect to a managed Kafka service.
entry.title: Feature: Managed Kafka Connection

entry.content: Chat code suggestions are displayed in a preview block by default with VS Code Gemini Code Assist 2.37.0, improving the readability of generated chat responses. You can configure preview pane settings to alternatively display chat code suggestions as fully collapsed or expanded.
entry.summary: Gemini Code Assist for VS Code now displays chat code suggestions in a preview block by default, enhancing readability. Users can customize this setting to have suggestions appear fully collapsed or expanded.
entry.title: Chat code suggestion preview: Gemini Code Assist: Code Suggestions Preview

entry.summary: This feature allows users to easily manage and organize their data with advanced filtering and sorting options.
entry.title: Feature: New Data Management Feature

entry.content: You can revert to a checkpoint for chat code suggestions with VS Code Gemini Code Assist 2.37.0, in Preview. Reverting to a checkpoint enables you to revert affected source files to a point before any code suggestions were applied.
entry.summary: You can now revert source files to a previous state before code suggestions were applied using VS Code Gemini Code Assist version 2.37.0. This feature is in Preview.
entry.title: Revert to a checkpoint (Preview): Revert to Checkpoint Feature Available

entry.summary: This feature allows users to easily create and manage their projects.
entry.title: Feature: New Project Management Feature

entry.content: You can configure local codebase awareness with VS Code Gemini Code Assist 2.37.0.
entry.summary: You can configure local codebase awareness with VS Code Gemini Code Assist version 2.37.0.
entry.title: Configure local codebase awareness: Configure local codebase awareness

entry.summary: This feature allows users to easily manage their cloud resources.
entry.title: Feature: New Resource Management Feature

entry.content: You can now configure the use of .aiexclude and .gitignore files to exclude files from the local context with VS Code Gemini Code Assist (version 2.36.0).
entry.summary: You can now exclude files from your local context using `.aiexclude` and `.gitignore` files with VS Code Gemini Code Assist version 2.36.0.
entry.title: Configure AI exclusion files: Configure AI exclusion files

entry.summary: The new feature allows users to create and manage their projects more efficiently.
entry.title: Feature: New Project Management Feature

entry.id: urn:github:multani:gcp-changelog:gemini-code-assist:2025-06-12:add code snippets to the chat context:3
entry.content: You can now select, attach, and direct Gemini to focus on code snippets with VS Code Gemini Code Assist (version 2.36.0). Code snippet selection enables discrete analysis of smaller code blocks instead of entire files, as Preview.
entry.summary: You can now add code snippets to the chat context in VS Code Gemini Code Assist (version 2.36.0). This feature allows for the analysis of smaller code blocks instead of entire files, improving the focus and efficiency of the Gemini assistant.
entry.title: Add code snippets to the chat context: New: Add code snippets to chat context

entry.summary: This feature allows users to do X, Y, and Z.
entry.title: Feature: New Feature Announcement

entry.id: urn:github:multani:gcp-changelog:gemini-code-assist:2025-06-12:add terminal output to the chat context:5
entry.content: Terminal output can now be attached to the chat context with VS Code Gemini Code Assist (version 2.36.0). You can now ask Gemini Code Assist questions about terminal commands and output, as Preview.
entry.summary: You can now include terminal output in your VS Code Gemini Code Assist chats (version 2.36.0). This allows you to ask questions about terminal commands and their output, enhancing your workflow.
entry.title: Add terminal output to the chat context: Add terminal output to chat context

entry.summary: This feature allows users to create and manage custom roles.
entry.title: Feature: Custom Role Management

entry.content: VS Code Gemini Code Assist (version 2.35.0) now automatically scrolls through chat responses, enabling easier and faster readability. You can disable automatic scrolling in the Gemini Code Assist settings.
entry.summary: VS Code Gemini Code Assist version 2.35.0 now automatically scrolls through chat responses, making it easier to read them quickly. You can turn this feature off in the extension's settings.
entry.title: Automatic scrolling: Gemini Code Assist: Automatic Scrolling Enabled

entry.summary: This is a longer summary about the new feature.
entry.title: Feature: New Feature Announcement

entry.content: You can now stop chat responses with VS Code Gemini Code Assist (version 2.35.0). Undesired long running or errant chat responses are immediately halted.
entry.summary: You can now stop in-progress chat responses in VS Code Gemini Code Assist. This feature allows you to immediately halt undesired long running or errant chat responses.
entry.title: Stop in-progress chat responses: Stop in-progress chat responses

entry.summary: This new feature allows users to easily create and manage custom alerts for their applications.
entry.title: Feature: Custom Alerts Feature

entry.content: You can now click filenames referenced in a chat response to open the file in the IDE with VS Code Gemini Code Assist (2.35.0), as Preview.
entry.summary: You can now click on filenames mentioned in chat responses to open them directly in your IDE with VS Code Gemini Code Assist (version 2.35.0). This feature is currently in Preview.
entry.title: Clickable filenames in chat (Preview): Clickable Filenames in Chat (Preview)

entry.summary: This is a longer summary of the content, which is not provided.
entry.title: Feature: Short title without Google Cloud

entry.content: Context exclusion of files using .gitIgnore is now enforced. Files present in .gitignore are now excluded from the local context with chat, code generation, code completion, and code transformation, as Preview.
entry.summary: Files listed in your .gitignore file are now automatically excluded from your local context. This applies to chat, code generation, code completion, and code transformation features, enhancing privacy and focus. This feature is currently in Preview.
entry.title: Exclude files from local context (Preview): Exclude files from local context

entry.summary: This feature allows users to easily manage their cloud resources.
entry.title: Feature: New Resource Management Feature

entry.id: urn:github:multani:gcp-changelog:gemini-code-assist:2025-05-28:manage files and folders in the context drawer:1
entry.content:
You can now view and manage files and folders requested to be included in Gemini Code Assist's context, using the Context Drawer. After you specify a file or folder to be used as context for your Gemini Code Assist prompts, these files and folders are placed in the Context Drawer, where you can review and remove them from the prompt context.

This gives you more control over which information Gemini Code Assist considers when responding to your prompts.
entry.summary: You can now manage files and folders in the Context Drawer to have more control over the information Gemini Code Assist considers in its responses.
entry.title: Manage files and folders in the Context Drawer: Manage files and folders in Context Drawer
